glsa.title: Linux Audit: Buffer overflow
glsa.synopsis: A buffer overflow vulnerability in Linux Audit may allow local attackers to execute arbitrary code.

background.p: Linux Audit is a set of userspace utilities for storing and processing auditing records.

description.p: A stack-based buffer overflow has been reported in the audit_log_user_command() function in the file lib/audit_logging.c when processing overly long arguments.

impact.p: A local attacker could execute a specially crafted command on the host running Linux Audit, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running Linux Audit.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
